data.enText: pleasant to look at, especially in a sexual way
data.chText: 性感的；妩媚的；英俊的；诱人的
妩媚的女人

data.enText: I like John but I don't find him attractive physically.
data.chText: 我喜欢约翰，不过我认为他长得并不英俊。
吸引人的；令人愉快的

before.enText: of a thing or a place

data.enText: a big house with an attractive garden
data.chText: 带有美丽花园的一所巨宅

data.enText: That's one of the less attractive aspects of her personality.
data.chText: 那是她个性中不太讨人喜欢的一面。

data.enText: having features or qualities that make sth seem interesting and worth having
data.chText: （事物）有吸引力的，诱人的
诱人的提议

data.enText: The room is arranged very attractively.
data.chText: 这个房间布置得十分宜人。
价格诱人的旅馆房间
国外旅游的吸引力

data.text: beautiful ♦ pretty ♦ handsome ♦ attractive ♦ lovely ♦ good-looking ♦ gorgeous

data.enText: These words all describe people who are pleasant to look at.
data.chText: 以上各词均形容人好看。

data.enText: (especially of a woman or girl) very pleasant to look at
data.chText: （尤指女子或女孩）漂亮的，美丽的：

data.enText: She looked stunningly beautiful that night.
data.chText: 她那天晚上美极了。

data.enText: (especially of a girl or woman) pleasant to look at
data.chText: （尤指女孩或女子）漂亮的，俊俏的：

data.enText: She's got a very pretty face.
data.chText: 她有一张非常俏丽的脸。

data.enText: Pretty is used most often to talk about girls. When it is used to talk about a woman, it usually suggests that she is like a girl, with small, delicate features.
data.chText: pretty多用以指女孩。如果用以指女子，通常表示这女子像女孩一样小巧玲珑。

data.enText: (of a man) pleasant to look at; (of a woman) pleasant to look at, with large strong features rather than small delicate ones
data.chText: 指（男子）英俊的，漂亮的；（女子）健美的：

data.enText: He was described as ‘ tall, dark and handsome ’.
data.chText: 他被描述为“高大黝黑、相貌堂堂”。

data.enText: (of a person) pleasant to look at, especially in a sexual way
data.chText: 指（人）性感的、妩媚的、俊朗的、迷人的：
她是个非常迷人的女子。
指（人）美丽的、迷人的：

data.enText: She looked particularly lovely that night.
data.chText: 她那天晚上特别妩媚动人。

data.enText: When you describe sb as lovely , you are usually showing that you also have a strong feeling of affection for them.
data.chText: 用lovely形容人时，通常表示说话者很喜欢这个人。

data.enText: (of a person) pleasant to look at, often in a sexual way
data.chText: 指（人）好看的、漂亮的、性感的：

data.enText: She arrived with a very good-looking man.
data.chText: 她和一个非常英俊的男人一起到来。

data.enText: ( informal ) (of a person) extremely attractive, especially in a sexual way
data.chText: 指（人）非常漂亮的、美丽动人的、性感的：
你美极了！
用attractive还是good-looking？

data.enText: If you describe sb as attractive you often also mean that they have a pleasant personality as well as being pleasant to look at; good-looking just describes sb's physical appearance.
data.chText: 用attractive形容人时，常常还表示这人不仅长得漂亮，性格也很可爱，而good-looking只指人的长相好看。

simple_means.memory_skill: attract v.引来 + -ive 形容词后缀

tr: pleasing to the eye or mind especially through beauty or charm

example: the job is attractive because of the pay

example.tran: 她是个妩媚动人的女子。

example.ex: I thought he was very attractive and obviously very intelligent...
example.tran: 我觉得他魅力非凡，才智过人。

example.ex: He was always immensely attractive to women.
example.tran: 他总是让女人们神魂颠倒。

value.def: A person who is attractive is pleasant to look at.

example.ex: Most of us would maintain that physical attractiveness does not play a major part in how we react to the people we meet.
example.tran: 我们大部分人坚持认为我们对遇到的人作出何种反应并不取决于其外在的魅力。

example.ex: The flat was small but attractive, if rather shabby...
example.tran: 虽然有些老旧，这仍不失为一个漂亮的小公寓。

example.ex: The creamy white flowers are attractive in the spring.
example.tran: 在春天，这种乳白色的花朵分外迷人。

value.def: Something that is attractive has a pleasant appearance or sound.

example.ex: It's an attractively illustrated, detailed guide that's very practical.
example.tran: 这是一本很实用的指南，插图精美，内容详尽。

example.ex: The forest will enhance the attractiveness of the region.
example.tran: 这片森林会为该地区平添更多魅力。

example.ex: Co-operation was more than just an attractive option, it was an obligation...
example.tran: 合作不仅仅是诱人的选择，它也是一种责任。

example.ex: Smoking is still attractive to many young people who see it as glamorous.
example.tran: 吸烟对很多年轻人还是很有诱惑力，他们觉得这让自己显得魅力十足。

value.def: You can describe something as attractive when it seems worth having or doing.
value.tran: 吸引人的;值得拥有（或做）的

example.ex: The services are attractively priced and are tailored to suit individual requirements.
example.tran: 服务费价格诱人且内容按个人需求量身定制。

example.ex: The attractiveness of the schemes depends almost entirely on tax relief.
example.tran: 该方案之所以吸引人几乎全倚仗其税费减免政策。

trans: 魅力质量；有魅力的品质；魅力品质；魅力质量因素；吸引力的质量

partsOfSpeech.dec: attract v.引来 + -ion 行为,状态
act 行动,做 + -ive 形容词后缀
creat(e) 创造 + -ive 形容词后缀
expens(e) 费用 + -ive 形容词后缀
relate 联系,关联 + -ive 形容词后缀
pass 走,跨过 + -ive 形容词后缀
ad- 加强 + ject 投掷,扔 + -ive 形容词后缀
aggress vi.攻击 + -ive 形容词后缀
alternate 轮流,(使)交替 + -ive 形容词后缀
at- 加强 + tent 伸展 + -ive 形容词后缀
collect v.收集 + -ive 形容词后缀
com- 共同, 一起 + prehend 抓, 抓住 + -ive 形容词后缀
effect n.结果 + -ive 形容词后缀
ex- 出,出去 + cess 行走,撤退 + -ive 形容词后缀
execut(e) 执行 + -ive 形容词后缀
ex- 出,出去 + tens 伸展 + -ive 形容词后缀
impress v.使（人）赞赏尊敬 + -ive 形容词后缀

partsOfSpeech.d: 短时间内集中紧张进行的
partsOfSpeech.dec: intens(e) 高度的,极度的 + -ive 形容词后缀
posit 放 + -ive 形容词后缀
pro- 向前,在前 + duct 引导 + -ive 形容词后缀
progress n.前进 + -ive 形容词后缀
protect v.保护 + -ive 形容词后缀
re- 相对,相反 + spect 看 + -ive 形容词后缀
suc- 在...下面 + cess- 走开;撤退 + -ive 形容词后缀
destruct v.毁坏 + -ive 形容词后缀
co- 共同,一起 + oper- 工作 + -ate 做,造成 + -ive 形容词后缀
ex- 出,出去 + clus 关闭 + -ive 形容词后缀
con- 共同,一起 + secut 跟随 + -ive 形容词后缀
prospect n.未来事件发生的可能性 + -ive 形容词后缀
in- 在内,进入,使 + clus 关闭 + -ive 形容词后缀
de- 离开,向下 + cis 切,割 + -ive 形容词后缀
initiat(e) 入会 + -ive 形容词后缀

partsOfSpeech.d: 大量的，巨大的，大规模的
partsOfSpeech.dec: mass 大量 + -ive 形容词后缀
narrat(e) 叙述 + -ive 形容词后缀
in- 在内,进入,使 + cent 唱,歌 + -ive 形容词后缀
subject n.题目 + -ive 形容词后缀
per- 完全 + spect- 看 + -ive 形容词后缀
indicat(e) 指示 + -ive 形容词后缀
